item.description:

item.description:
失去俄罗斯管道供应将刺激对液化天然气的需求，并可能挤压较贫穷的新兴国家。【原文：

Loss of Russian pipeline supplies will stoke demand for LNG and could squeeze out poorer emerging nations.

】

item.title: 3% 通胀率的警告令英格兰银行更加头疼
item.description: 经济学家警告说，到春季通胀率将超过 3%，英格兰银行可能面临一场新的战斗，以向投资者保证其降息承诺。【原文：The Bank of England could face a fresh battle to reassure investors of its commitment to interest rate cuts, with economists warning of inflation above 3% by the spring.】

item.title: 卢比跌破 86 新纪录，美元反弹，石油大涨
item.description: 在强劲的美国就业数据抑制了对美联储进一步降息的押注后，印度卢比跌破了1美元兑86卢比的关键心理价位，而油价的飙升也影响了这个石油净进口国的情绪。【原文：India’s rupee fell past a key psychological level of 86 per dollar after strong US jobs data damped bets on further Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts and as a surge in oil prices weighed on sentiment for the net oil-importing nation.】

item.title: CATL 准备为 50 亿美元港股销售挑选银行
item.description: 当代安培信息科技有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.据熟悉内情的人士透露，当代安佰利科技股份有限公司准备聘请美国银行、中国国际金融有限公司、中证金融有限公司和摩根大通银行作为今年在香港第二次上市的牵头安排人。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is poised to hire Bank of America Corp., China International Capital Corp., CSC Financial Co. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. as lead arrangers for a second listing in Hong Kong this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国人民银行行长潘功胜：中国政策重心将更多转向消费
item.description: 中国央行行长表示，中国将促进消费在经济中的作用，不再只关注投资，过去二十年来决定中国经济增长的模式将发生转变。【原文：China will promote the role of consumption in the economy and move away from its sole focus on investment, according to the central bank governor, ushering in a shift in the growth model that’s come to define the country over the past two decades.】

item.title: 俄罗斯液化天然气货运靠近西班牙，测试最新制裁的影响
item.description: 一艘液化天然气油轮上周五装载了一批来自被华盛顿制裁的俄罗斯工厂的货物，这艘油轮将成为检验买家是否愿意规避最新一轮惩罚性措施的第一艘船。【原文：A liquefied natural gas tanker carrying a shipment from a Russian plant sanctioned by Washington on Friday is poised to be the first to test buyers’ willingness to circumvent the latest round of punitive measures.】

item.title: 苹果人工智能缺席中国市场，iPhone 失去全球市场份额
item.description: 苹果公司去年的 iPhone 销量减少，并在中国竞争对手面前败下阵来，这反映了苹果智能手机在其美国以外最大市场的缺失。【原文：Apple Inc. sold fewer iPhones and lost ground to Chinese rivals last year, reflecting the absence of Apple Intelligence in its largest market outside the US.】

item.title: 引领债务改革的中国开发商再次面临风险
item.description: 就在一年多以前，融创中国控股有限公司（Sunac China Holdings Ltd.）达成了中国开发商的首个重大离岸债务重组交易，成为中国违约开发商的典范。现在，它的问题又越来越多。【原文：Just over a year ago, Sunac China Holdings Ltd. became a model for the country’s defaulted developers by clinching the sector’s first major offshore debt restructuring deal. Now its problems are mounting again.】

item.title: 石油制裁引发市场震荡，"熊市 "受到挑战
item.description: 几个月来，全球石油市场的共识是，2025 年将是石油大量过剩、价格平缓至疲软的一年。突然之间，在美国对俄罗斯能源业实施了迄今为止最大胆的一揽子制裁之后，前景变得更加复杂。【原文：For months, the consensus in the global oil market was that 2025 would be a year marked by a bulky surplus and flat-to-soft pricing. Suddenly — after the boldest package of US sanctions yet against Russia’s energy industry — the outlook is more complicated.】

item.title: 莱恩称欧洲央行将在风险中进一步放松政策
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）表示，欧洲中央银行可能会进一步降低利率，以确保完成其稳定物价的任务。【原文：The European Central Bank is likely to reduce interest rates further in order to ensure it delivers on its price stability mandate, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 违约建筑商 Shimao 收到新的清盘申请
item.description: 世茂集团控股有限公司（Shimao Group Holdings Ltd.）在上次清盘案被驳回一个月后，再次在香港收到清盘呈请，为这家违约建筑商的重组增添了新的不确定性。【原文：Shimao Group Holdings Ltd. received another liquidation petition in Hong Kong, one month after its last winding-up case was dismissed, adding new uncertainty to the defaulted builder’s restructuring.】

item.title: 高盛策略师认为跌跌不休的中国股市将在 2025 年上涨 20
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists are sticking to their bullish stance on Chinese stocks despite an ongoing rout, predicting that benchmarks will rise about 20% by year-end.】

item.title: 前美联储副主席认为特朗普不会威胁美联储的自主权
item.description: 美联储前副主席兰道尔-夸尔斯（Randal Quarles）表示，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普上台后，美联储的独立性不会受到威胁，通货膨胀和劳动力市场也不会受到威胁。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s independence won’t be in jeopardy once President-elect Donald Trump takes office, neither are inflation and the labor market, according to former Federal Reserve Vice Chair Randal Quarles.】

item.title: 麦格理投资部门聘用 Gabriel Ho 推进东南亚业务
item.description: 麦格理集团（Macquarie Group Ltd.）聘请了一位新的董事总经理，作为该公司投资部门进军东南亚市场的一部分。【原文：Macquarie Group Ltd. has hired a new managing director as part of a push in Southeast Asia for the firm’s investing arm.】

item.title: 印尼银行承诺在美国就业数据火爆后捍卫印尼盾
item.description: 印尼银行承诺将继续努力稳定印尼盾，因为美国政策利率居高不下的前景给新兴市场带来了压力。【原文：Bank Indonesia has pledged to continue its attempts to stabilize the rupiah, as the prospect of US policy rates staying high puts pressure on emerging markets.】

item.title: 特朗普关税逼近前中国出口创纪录增长
item.description: 在当选总统唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫之前，中国出口创下历史新高，因为企业急于将货物运出国门，以弥补国内低迷的需求。【原文：Chinese exports hit a record high as companies rushed to get goods out the door to make up for sluggish demand at home and ahead of the return of President-elect Donald Trump to the White House.】

item.title: Paul Weiss 从 Wachtell 聘请 Carmen Lu 担任激进主义辩护律师
item.description: Carmen Lu 将加入 Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP 律师事务所，为律师事务所从事激进主义辩护工作。【原文：Carmen Lu is joining Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP to work on activism defense situations for the law firm.】

item.title: 中国通过警告和资本管制调整加强对人民币的支持
item.description: 在人民币兑美元汇率在离岸交易中跌至历史新低后，中国发出警告并调整了资本管制措施，加大了对人民币的支持力度。【原文：China ramped up its support for the yuan with a warning and tweaks to its capital controls, after the currency dropped close to a record low against the dollar in offshore trading.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦财政部长有信心满足国际货币基金组织的救助条件
item.description: 巴基斯坦财政部长穆罕默德-奥朗泽布（Muhammad Aurangzeb）表示，在国际货币基金组织准备于下月访问巴基斯坦之际，巴基斯坦政府乐观地认为，它将满足国际货币基金组织对正在进行的 70 亿美元贷款的要求，包括提高税收。【原文：The Pakistan government is optimistic it will meet the International Monetary Fund’s terms for an ongoing $7 billion loan including a higher tax revenue as the fund prepares to visit next month, according to Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb.】

item.title: 即使在制裁俄罗斯之前，看涨布伦特货币的赌注也已达到五月高点
item.description: 甚至在华盛顿宣布针对俄罗斯能源业的一揽子全面制裁之前，基金经理们就已经积累了八个月来最大的布伦特原油净多头头寸。【原文：Money managers had amassed the biggest net-long positions on Brent oil in eight months, even before Washington announced a sweeping package of sanctions targeting Russia’s energy industry.】

item.title: 交易商寻求从美国利率不确定性中获得安全感，黄金保持涨势
item.description: 黄金连续四天反弹，由于美联储加息路径的新不确定性，风险厌恶情绪席卷市场，交易商纷纷寻求避险资产的庇护。【原文：Gold held a four-day rally, with traders seeking refuge in the haven asset as risk-off sentiment swept markets on fresh uncertainty over the Federal Reserve’s rate path.】

item.title: 里夫斯从中国归来，人们呼吁直面英国金沙送彩金的网站困境
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）周一将从中国返回英国，工党希望借此摆脱围绕财政困难的市场动荡，并强调政府的长期雄心。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves returns to the UK from China on Monday with the Labour Party keen to brush off market turmoil around its fiscal difficulties and emphasize the government’s long-term ambitions.】

item.title: 美国对俄罗斯能源实施全面制裁后，石油涨势扩大
item.description: 由于美国对俄罗斯能源业的新一轮制裁威胁到本已趋紧的全球市场的原油供应，石油涨幅扩大，接近三个月高点。【原文：Oil extended gains to trade near a three-month high as fresh wave of US sanctions against Russia’s energy industry threatened to crimp crude supplies in an already-tightening global market.】

item.title: 韩元接近关键心理价位令韩国雪上加霜
item.description: 由于政治风险和经济增长放缓强化了更多降息的理由，韩元在跌至 2009 年以来最低点后可能扩大跌幅。【原文：The South Korean won may extend losses after sliding to the lowest since 2009, as political risks and slowing economic growth reinforce the case for more interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 英国将为新的人工智能数据中心计划探索核能
item.description: 作为工党政府促进技术发展和人工智能生态系统项目的一部分，英国正在规划用于建设数据中心的特殊区域，并将探索将核能专用于这些地点。【原文：The UK is planning special districts for constructing data centers and will explore dedicating nuclear energy to the sites as part of a Labour government project to boost technology growth and the ecosystem for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 美国就业形势大好，亚洲股市承压：市场综述
item.description: 周一亚洲股市早盘下跌，因为强劲的美国就业数据导致交易商重新思考美联储的降息之路。【原文：Asian stocks were headed for early declines Monday after strong US jobs data led traders to rethink the path ahead for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 影响天气的拉尼娜现象卷土重来。随着农产品成本上升，全球食品价格再次上涨。对关税的担忧促使贸易商将金属转移到北美仓库。【原文：The weather-influencing La Niña phenomena is making a comeback. Global food prices are rising again as agricultural goods get more costly. And tariff fears are pushing traders to shift metals into North American warehouses.】

item.title: 贝恩与 CC Capital 18 亿美元收购 Insignia 的报价不相上下
item.description: 随着澳大利亚财富管理公司 Insignia Financial Ltd. 的收购活动升温，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）提高了对该公司的出价。【原文：Bain Capital sweetened its bid for Insignia Financial Ltd. as takeover activity heats up for the Australian wealth manager.】

item.title: 强生公司正在探索竞购细胞内治疗技术
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）正在探索收购一家专注于治疗中枢神经系统疾病的生物制药公司 Intra-Cellular Therapies Inc.【原文：Johnson & Johnson is exploring a bid to acquire Intra-Cellular Therapies Inc., a biopharmaceutical company focused on treatments for central nervous system disorders, people familiar with the matter said.】
